intro: Manulea pillansii, commonly known as the Pillans' manulea, is a rare and endemic plant species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant is typically found in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, while its small white flowers bloom in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Manulea pillansii is considered a vulnerable species.
